author: Douglas Gray

review: Google isn't the only game in town, but they do it right.The packaging was superb; a nice flip-top box akin to what software used to come in. No get-your-industrial-scissors-out-this-plastic-is-indestructable kind of cheapo thing. It looks classy.The device itself is nothing to speak of; it just works. Installation was trivial, and it worked the first time.That's more than I can say for a lot of products. We use this _all_ _the_ _time_. For watching Netflix movies, YouTube videos, even sharing vacation photos with a large group. So do your Netflix browsing from your computer, cast it to the TV, then retire to the couch, where you can control it from your iPod. Pretty sweet.On some family nights we trade off sharing videos we've found during the week, me from my iPod and my son from his Android phone. Without us having to crowd around the computer.Yah, so we're just lazy couch potatoes? Well, maybe, but that's besides the point. This is a great little product, and it works exactly as advertised. 10 stars.

author: Here In Jersey

review: I was excited to try this, having heard so many people talk about it, but it doesn't come close to matching what the Roku can do.  For example, in order for it to work you have to make sure your phone, tablet or PC is constantly connected and on.  So if you are trying to stream Netflix to it via your mobile phone and you decide to leave the house you better hope nobody else at your house is watching it because as soon as you leave the wireless network - poof - it stops.It seemed every unintuitive, and even as an IT geek I found myself trying to figure out just what I was supposed to do.  There are no channels per say, you just have to go find what you want to watch and then tell it to cast it.  This would be very confusing for children or older adults who just want to watch something, not spend all day searching and trying to find the magic button to make it work.I tried it for a week, but then sent it back and ordered two more Roku 3's for my televisions.  Much happier with the Roku setup, and much easier to use!
